subject: Simsonn VAM PRO issues with Plus X pedals
description_text:
Hello,

I am encountering issues while using Simsonn VAM PRO with Plus X pedals,
specifically random disconnections/missing inputs/blocked inputs from the
pedals in eg. iRacing.

I have:
- grounded the control box to the pedal metal plate,
- tried to put it under the metal plate of the pedals with - metal screw,
without metal screw (adhesive tape), on the floor
- tried with simhub only (I need it working during the sessions so it's not
an option to close it),
- tried with Simhub and Simsonn manager 2.1.2 (even worse)
- tried to Faraday cage the control box with aluminum foil on the floor
(even worse disconnecting/blockages)

Pedals do work properly when power cable for the VAMs is unplugged. I lost
a lot of Safety Rating since installing the VAMs due to random
disconnections which I fortunately made back since unplugging them.

Also when I plug the AC cable in the control box, I can see some tiny
sparks coming from the slot, which is worrying.

Please offer me some help.


*Alexandru Șerban*
*+40 749 629994*

conversations.body_text: Hi Alexandru Serban,    I need to clarify something: for VAM motors, you must use VAM mode, not VAM Pro mode. The software provides this option because using VAM Pro mode can quickly damage the VAM motor.  Could you tell me how you have been using it? Also, which motors are currently working and which are not?     Additionally, regarding the sparks from the independent power supply, this is normal when the power is charging the motor capacitors. It is a normal phenomenon. Since it is 24V, it is safe and will not damage the main control unit, so please rest assured.

Hello,

So I should use VAM mode even if I have the VAM PRO product?

As for the motors, they both work (brake and throttle), they only get stuck
vibrating sometimes when the pedal input stops/blocks to last percentage
for some seconds.



*​Alexandru Șerban*
​
*+40 749 629994​​*

Hi Alexandru Serban,  If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.  https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding
